intro: Buddleja variabilis, commonly known as the variable weeping buddleia, is a deciduous shrub native to China. It is characterized by its long, drooping panicles of fragrant, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are typically gray-green in appearance. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is drought-tolerant once established. Buddleja variabilis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators like butterflies and bees.
